resources.string: Mastermind is a code breaking game based on the classic board game of the same name. " " " "A sequence of colours is selected, this is the code length and it can be changed before starting a new game." " " "The aim of the game is to guess the correct positions and colour of the sequence. " " " "The default setting is that a colour can only be used once in the code sequence. " " " "However, if allow duplicates is selected in the game setup screen then colours can be used any number of times." " " "The player then guesses the code sequence by filling in a line and “confirming” their guess. " " " "The result will be displayed on the right of the board and will return either: " " " " • A red pin, which indicates that there is a correct colour in the correct position in your guess." " " " • A white pin, which indicates that there is a correct colour in the wrong position in your guess." " " " • A blank pin, which indicates that the colour chosen, is not in the code. " " " "The game is won when all of the colours in your guess are in the correct position and you have solved the code. " " " "The game is lost if you run out of guesses, or the time limit expires. " " " "Both of these settings can be changed in the game set up.

~~~~~~~~Single player~~~~~~~~" " " " The code is randomly generated by the computer based on the code length you specify in the game set up." " " "The player then guesses the code and attempts to break it in the number of guesses and time limit chosen." " " "The player wins if they are successful in cracking the code." " " "~~~~~~~Local Multiplayer~~~~~~~" " " "The code is selected by player two on the same device." " " " Player two then submits the code." " " " Player one is then handed the device and must attempt to crack the code." " " "If player one solves the code then they are the winner." " " "However, if they fail to solve the code then player two is the winner." " " "~~~~~~~Online Multiplayer~~~~~~~" " " "Two players enter a game, matched upon their settings, and play over 3 rounds." " " "One player is chosen at random to set the code for the first round." " " "Player two will then attempt to crack this code as player one watches." " " "If they are successful then they win the round, if they are unsuccessful then player one wins the round." " " "Round 2 is the same as round one except the roles are changed." " " " Player two will now set the code and player one will attempt to crack the code." " " "Round 3 is the final round of the game." " " "In this round, both players will receive the same code generated by the computer." " " "They will then compete head-to-head to solve the code; the first one to crack it wins the round." " " "If neither player solves the code in the time limit or runs out of guesses then the round is a draw." " " "The winner and loser is then displayed or in the result of the same score, a draw is declared.
